attributes.action: Strip Sir Christopher Chope of his knighthood
attributes.additional_details:
Christopher Chope MP has long record of blocking reform. 

Some of his actions include:

●	Opposing free parking at hospitals for carers.
●	Opposing a pardon for Alan Turing
●	Blocked protection for poor countries against “Vulture funds”
●	Objected to a debate on the Hillsborough disaster
●	Blocked action against revenge evictions of tenants
●	Blocked a law to stop people who attack police dogs from claiming self defence
●	Blocked a law to avoid the excessive force in mental health units
attributes.background:
Christopher Chope MP for Christchurch blocked a Bill to ban "Upskirting". 

If passed, someone who takes a photo under a victim's skirt could face 2 years in prison.

The Bill had Government and all party support, but rules mean it only requires one MP to shout "object" to block its progress.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions asking for people's honours to be taken away. You can find out more about how honours are taken away here:

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/having-honours-taken-away-forfeiture

If you'd like the procedure of objecting to Bills to change, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/222338

If you'd like the law on upskirting to change, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/216290
